meanings.definition: Of or relating to the present time or the immediate past.
meanings.sent1: The art gallery featured an ultracontemporary exhibit showcasing modern paintings.
meanings.sent2: Her ultracontemporary outfit was a perfect fit for the trendy party.
meanings.sent3: The time traveler found himself in an ultracontemporary era, struggling to adapt to the new technology.
meanings.sent4: The ultracontemporary design of the building stood out among the traditional architecture.
meanings.sent5: The ultracontemporary music festival attracted a young and vibrant crowd.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the latest styles, techniques, or technology.
meanings.sent1: The smartphone company released its ultracontemporary model with advanced features.
meanings.sent2: The fashion show displayed ultracontemporary clothing designs that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with ultracontemporary cooking methods, surprising the diners with unique flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her ultracontemporary approach to photography revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent5: The ultracontemporary car design incorporated futuristic elements for a sleek look.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is extremely modern or current.
meanings.sent1: The tech guru was considered an ultracontemporary in the field of artificial intelligence.
meanings.sent2: The museum acquired an ultracontemporary sculpture to add to its modern art collection.
meanings.sent3: The robot claimed to be an ultracontemporary in the world of automation, always up to date with the latest trends.
meanings.sent4: She was known as an ultracontemporary in the fashion industry for her innovative designs.
meanings.sent5: The startup company aimed to be an ultracontemporary in the market by introducing cutting-edge products.
